For local testing, the same CMake build used on Windows can be tested out on macOS with the following command:

cmake -G Ninja -S .github/workflows/Windows -B .build/SDG/CMake -DCMAKE_Swift_FLAGS='-I /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Platforms/MacOSX.platform/Developer/usr/lib -F /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Platforms/MacOSX.platform/Developer/Library/Frameworks' -DCMAKE_Swift_FLAGS='-F /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Platforms/MacOSX.platform/Developer/Library/Frameworks -L /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Platforms/MacOSX.platform/Developer/usr/lib -Xlinker -rpath -Xlinker /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Platforms/MacOSX.platform/Developer/Library/Frameworks' && cmake --build .build/SDG/CMake && (cd .build/SDG/CMake && ctest --output-on-failure)
